intro: Micrandra siphonioides var. minor, commonly known as the lesser siphonioid micrandra, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, woodland environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
